Question 67) It is known that increasing gas concentration such as CO2, CH4 and N2O in the atmosphere is one of the factors responsible for aggravation of the greenhouse effect. Agriculture is one of the human activities that can contribute to both emission and sequestration of these gases, depending on the management of soil organic matter.
ROSA, A. H.; COELHO, J. C. R. NOVAL CHEMISTRY NOTEBOOKS IN SCHOOL, How can agricultural practices help minimize the worsement of the greenhouse effect?
A) avoiding crop rotation.
B) releasing the CO2 present in the ground.
C) increasing the amount of soil organic matter.
D) burning the organic matter that deposits in the soil.
E) attenuating the concentration of plant waste from the soil.
